results.title: The Work of the kidneys
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
The film opens with an analogy between the kidneys and the selective processes by which they eliminate waste from the body, and the machines which select various devices. Laboratory experiments show the properties of semi-permeable membranes which function in the kidneys and allow wastes to pass but restrict the passage of food materials. Content analysis charts demonstrate the difference between glomerular fluid and urine. Factors affecting the rate of urine formation, such as blood sugar content and external factors are also examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films

results.title: Muscle: dynamics of contraction
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
The many hundreds of muscles in the human body differ greatly with respect to the speeds at which they shorten. They can be divided into three major categories: smooth, cardiac and skeletal. In this film these three types are defined, and elaborate apparatus is used to reveal that the contractile properties of a whole muscle can be explained in terms of the properties of the single muscle cell.

results.title: Fundamentals of the Nervous System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Live photography, microphotography, animated drawings and medical demonstrations illustrate the functions, diversions and specific tasks of the nervous system. Shows how it conveys information from sense organs to brain, co-ordinates information with experience and directs muscles and other organs to carry out adaptive behaviour.

results.title: The Eyes and seeing
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Studies the eye, its component structures and their functions. Close-up studies of the parts of the eye and experiments with animals in a visual perception laboratory provide a clear distinction between the physical process and the electro-chemical process of seeing. Considers how light sources are focused on the retina activating light sensitive cells. Examines problems in determining how the brain evaluates and acts on visual stimuli.

results.title: The Ears and hearing. [Rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Richard Barlow, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Structure and functions of the human ear and how it transmits sound waves to the brain. Discusses hearing malfunctions and records various stages of stapendectomy while the surgeon comments on the delicate procedures.

results.title: Big Fish Down Under
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Beyond the edge: professionals at play

results.title: Beyond the edge: professionals at play
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big Fish Down Under”.
An adventurous journey to the Coral Sea and to a remote, detached reef, called Holmes, beyond the edge of the Great Barrier Reef. It is a fishing and diving trip which includes exploring water 1,000 fathoms deep and investigating the decaying wreck of a Japanese longliner. Written and presented by Malcolm Florence.

results.title: Two faces of Gove
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, John Sparkes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Looks at the situation at Gove, after the 1971 Land Rights Case, in which the native title claims of the local people against the Nabalco Corporation were defeated. Considers the effect of the decision on the people of Yirrakala. Construction workers talk about their attitudes and relations with the local First Nations people. Shows social life and bauxite mining procedures.

results.title: Snowy Mountain riders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
In the Snowy Mountains of southern New South Wales, near Jindabyne, there is to be a horse meeting to honour the first settlers of the district. The film shows the rounding-up and breaking-in of wild brumbies for the picnic race meeting and comments on the change in the district over the years. Narrated by Ron Iddon.
